metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9369 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Sympa 6.2.38 through 6.2.52 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (disk consumption from temporary files, and a flood of notifications to listmasters) via a series of requests with malformed parameters.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9369` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sympa - 6.2.40~dfsg-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sympa package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.40~dfsg-4').
